msbt.message: I heard that a renowned chef would be serving up his finest today, so obviously I had to see for myself. As the island's foremost expert on fine dining, I consider it my duty. My delicious, mouthwatering duty.

The main attraction of Turkey Day is, of course, our hardworking turkey chef, Franklin. Hmm, I hadn't considered it before, but do you think the day could be named in his honor? <10_4 />How old is he?

Ah, ! I see we had the same idea. Great minds do tend to flock together. When I cook, there are foothills of ingredients spreading before mountains of dirty dishes! Faced with such a breathtaking vista, I came here to catch my breath.<10_4 /> And hope the dishes wash themselves.
Oh, did the chef recruit you as an ingredient gopher? It's very dear how much you always want to help. Well, if there's anything you can't find, look for a home chef with extra of what you need, .
Looking for some of those hard-to- find ingredients? I know how it is when you simply can't substitute. If even the chef is having trouble, I wonder how our neighbors cooking at home are doing
Have you ever seen such an exquisite dish? And what epicurean epics still await us, ?
Oh no. Oh, this won't do at all.<10_4 /> This food appears to be so good as to defy description! The others are looking to me to tell them how much to enjoy it, and I am quite speechless, .
Is everything served? I am simply overwhelmed with lovely aromas! So spoiled for choice, !

With all the dishes served, I can safely say that even MY lofty expectations have been exceeded! Now, what to dish up The clam chowder? Or the gratin? No, the fish meunièreoh, but the pumpkin pieI can't decide! All this magnificent cuisine has quite overwhelmed my refined tastes, !
All the dishes are lovely, and I have plenty of room in my stomach for seconds, !
Let me tell you, —I have eaten FOOD in my time, but nothing as good as Franklin just served.
I understand more food is on the way, so I must save some room. Be strong, !
Some culinary experiences go beyond mere words, brightening our lives in ways that transcend speech. Then again, some food just yanks the words out of you! Words like "scrumptious" and "."
The best complement to good food is good friends to share it with. What an exquisite day, !
How marvelous that cuisine of such quality was made with ingredients harvested on this very island! Was it Franklin's sublime skill or our extraordinary ingredients? It must certainly be both, !
I shall treasure the memories of this day and its wonderful food for a long time to come, .
Ooh, you can really appreciate the notes of in the ! Your contribution really made the dish, darling. Bravo, !
Mmm The has such a unique mouthfeel! Must be the at work Oh, yes, you provided that ingredient, of course. Well done, as always, !
Ooh, you can really appreciate the notes of manila clam in the ! Your contribution really made the dish, darling. Bravo, !
Mmm The has such a unique mouthfeel! Must be the manila clams at work Oh, yes, you provided that ingredient, of course. Well done, as always, !
Well, hello and welcome, !I must have gotten caught up in the Turkey Day spirit, because here I am COOKING, of all things!
! How ARE you?I'VE decided to try cooking today for the first time in simply AGES!Oh, don't give me that look—I have been known to cook without <10_5 />always burning down the island I live on.
What news from the outside world? I imagine everyone's starting to gather at the plaza? I'll be there, but I can't abandon my dish until it's worthy to be served by !
UGH! This. Is. INTOLERABLE!I'm afraid I'm more out of practice at cooking than I realized, and it's not going well. <10_4 />And I hate it.

By the by, I know this is a long shot, but you don't happen to have any extra , do you? When I went shopping for ingredients, I was sure I had some , but alas, no. If you run across any, I'll gladly trade another ingredient for it! Thanks awfully, .

Hold on one moment! Is that you have there? What miraculous timing! I was in quite the bind for want of just a soupçon of . I beg you, darling, have mercy on a poor , and trade with me for a different ingredient!
Happy to help!
I kinda need this...
Oh, I overstepped! Never mind, but if you run across some extra , let me know?
Oh, fiddlesticks! I can't finish this dish without , and I'm fresh out! If only I knew what to substitute for it. ? ?
Here you go!
Oooh, bad luck!
I keep re-checking the recipe, but no, is still written right there under "ingredients."! If you have a bit of , could I have it? I can trade another ingredient!
Sure, I'll trade!
Sorry, fresh out.
Sorry to grumble at you, darling. I just can't seem to regain my usual sunny manners! Later is fine. If you luck into some, I'll trade another ingredient for , .
Oh, no, that's fine I did shop beforehand, but I must have missed that I'd need . I have plenty of other ingredients, so if you find , I'd be happy to trade, .
Oh! Did I misunderstand? Never mind, then—I respect your ingredient boundaries, .
Oh, many apologies—I must have misspoke. I meant to say that I need ! I'm not sure what this is, , but I'm sure it's delicious in the right hands. <10_4 />Yours.
Oh, splendiferous! You are the hero who saved Turkey Day, ! I hope you make good use of this . I'm told it's the finest Bells can buy!
What a relief that I'll be able to finish my dish, thanks to you!To thank you properly, let me tell you a secret of cooking I ran across in my favorite cookbook.
It said that the best clam chowder has not only clams, but <10_5 />scallops as well, ! As we all know, scallops have a unique allure for the most refined of palates. Doesn't that sound divine?

Obviously the star of clam chowder is the clam, right, darling? But what if you added other shellfish as well?! Chowder with another, especially meaty shellfish could reach new heights of chowdery achievement!
The secret to the very best pumpkin pie is to make it a PUMPKINS pie, ! That is, for the best sweetness, texture, and color, the book said using 4 types of pumpkin is ideal.
While one mustn't neglect the foundation of a good pumpkin pie, namely the crust, the filling is key. And the best filling is based on different kinds of pumpkin coming together in harmony, .
It's not common knowledge, but crab makes a surprisingly scrumptious addition to a gratin dish. In particular, Dungeness crab can really make a gratin sing. Er, not LITERALLY, of course, .
A bit of crab in a gratin can lead the discerning gourmet to hitherto unexplored vistas of flavor. The book suggested a type, as well Hmm Prison crab? Jail crab? Oubliette crab?<10_4 /> crab?
Apparently the best way to spruce up a fish meunière is to include barred knifejaw in the mix. As everyone knows, the barred knifejaw is the good silver of fish, so it only makes sense, .

As you no doubt know, the presentation of a dish is vital, and the first bite is with the eyes. So the key to an outstanding fish meunière is to include a fish with a striped pattern to complete its look.
Thank you again for your help earlier, . You were QUITE the miracle worker. For a while there I thought the island might be denied the rare treat of a dish a la !
Your generosity earlier really saved my Turkey Day, . Thank you again, . It is wonderful to turn simple ingredients into a delicious dish, then not do it again for another year!
My cooking skills were a bit rusty, but I must say I acquitted myself admirably, ! Perhaps I'll go and take the air at the plaza before I settle into cleaning up.
It is lovely every now and then to put everything into a special meal, isn't it, ? Looking around, though, I realize that cleaning up after this every day would be a catastrophic nightmare.
It seems the food is being served now at the plaza. How do you suppose it all turned out? Cooking for oneself is all well and good, but I would like to sample the master at work, !
I thought I'd dust off my culinary skills in honor of Turkey Day! You'd best stand back, .
It's a bit shocking, I know, darling, that with all my grace and poise, I'm ALSO good at cooking! I'm afraid it's so, dear. But it's a rare treat for me to really pour myself into a dish like this, .
We have a renowned chef serving his signature dishes at the plaza today— Oh, is that why you're visiting?
Today was positively enchanting. But I am ready to be off my feet, ideally for the next week, !
Holidays like Turkey Day are a marvelous celebration of community, . I feel such gratitude for everyone who cooked, who helped with ingredients, or who even just ate!
An underappreciated element of the chef's craft is which dishes to put together—designing the whole menu. Of course, this means you have to try everything being offered. SUCH a thankless task, .
Turkey Day is certainly enjoyable, but it's a tiring kind of fun, doing all that cooking, . Of course, if I could convince Franklin to be my personal chef, I could eat like this every day

Ah, what a splendiferous Turkey Day this was! Rich cuisine made of the finest ingredients Rich conversation made with the highest-quality friendsAfter all this excitement, I don't know how I'll ever get to sleep tonight, !
Whew! I'm usually a stomach sleeper, but as full as I am, I'm not sure I can manage it tonight! I've never been able to sleep on my back though. I guess I'll just have to stay awake forever, .
Ah, such clear food and delicious weather! <10_4 />Wait. That's not it.Clearly, the happiness of the day has left me a bit addled, but I wouldn't trade it for anything, !
